text: The Great Observatories program is four large, powerful space-based telescopes. They are a series of satellites placed by NASA. Each Space observatory has been important to astronomy. * The Hubble Space Telescope (HST) looks at visible light and near-ultraviolet. It was launched in 1990. In 1997 ability to look at the near-infrared range was added. In 2009 there was a mission to service Hubble. * The Compton Gamma Ray Observatory (CGRO) looks at gamma rays. It also looks at some hard x-rays as well. It was launched in 1991. It was deorbited in 2000. * The Chandra X-ray Observatory (CXO) looks at soft x-rays. It was launched in 1999. * The Spitzer Space Telescope (SST) looks at the infrared spectrum. It was launched in 2003. Category:Telescopes Category:Astronomical observatories
